Room Quality.comm: The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, but some may require updating.

cont.itemA: The rooms were spacious and well appointed, we stayed in a studio with a king bed and full kitchen.
cont.itemB: The rooms are also very nice with large flat screens although they are quite small.

cont.itemA: The dressing area and shower were very clean, but the beds were not made up, and the floors were dirty.
cont.itemB: Rooms were very clean and quiet.

Location.comm: The location is convenient for bar and restaurant access, but noise can be an issue.

cont.itemA: The location is great for bar/ restaurant hopping on St Charles, and having the streetcar stop right out front made everything so easy.
cont.itemB: Good location, tiny rooms, and it's quite noisy.

itemA.Room Quality: The room was nicely appointed with a refrigerator, stove, and coffee pot.
itemA.Price: Went in June so the rates were very inexpensive.
itemA.Amenities: The pool is nice and clean, and there is a fun 24/7 bar next door for karaoke.

itemB.Room Quality: We splurged and booked two Bourbon Street balcony rooms for a post-graduation celebration with our two young adult daughters.
itemB.Service: Parking was also overpriced and scratched my spouse's custom car when the valet parked it.
itemB.Dining: Very good breakfast, one of the three hotel bars to the GREAT restaurant for breakfast.
